featured_reviews.review_id: I've been a member for almost a year now with royal oak as my home gym and it does feel like home. I've been to a lot of gyms but Anytime Fitness stands out as the most friendly, fun and challenging space there is. I cannot stress enough as to how good the environment is. Just showing up makes you want to work out and the crew is the friendliest of any gym I've ever come across in my life. I certainly did not go wrong by choosing Anytime Fitness and i know others feel the same as me. This is what fitness should look like. Challenging, exhausting, entertaining and fun.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I've been a member at anytime fitness in the past and each location has a different owner. I signed up for a trial pass after a few months off from my cancellation at another gym. When I came in, a younger male was helping me to activate the trial. I had received a text message saying the 7 day pass was no longer offered but a one day was available to claim. I decided to pass on the trial I booked in for and perhaps go another time. A few days later I got a text message offering a 7 day trial so my assumption that they were offering it to me since I wasn't coming in. The younger male at the front kept going back and forth and reading and explaining the text messages to me, not even doing anything to resolve or find a solution. Honestly, if he is looking to be a position of management in the future, making sure your guests are happy and feel taken cared for is the number one thing. The gym is a personal and intimate space and I was not happy with someone like that handling my account. He kept going back and forth and I literally said to him "honestly this is not my problem, what can we do about it". I told him either way a 1 day or a 7 day I'll take since I was already there. If it wasn't for Von I wouldn't even consider going to this location. Focus on learning conflict resolution instead of focusing on the problem and repeating it to the client thinking that it is the answer and will resolve it lol. Don't really need a male younger than me speaking to me like that but I'm patient enough to give people space to grow and learn, literally not my responsibility. The location is clean and quiet, I went around 2-3pm. They have a bag for Muay Thai

"I see we need to update our messaging system, I will check if we can honour the seven days but in the case we can't, is the one day trial for today okay with you?"

places.name: Gold's Gym West Broadway
places.address: Gold's Gym West Broadway, 709 W Broadway, Vancouver, BC V5Z 1J5

featured_reviews.review_id:
It's a nice gym - one of the best in Vancouver in terms of size and quality of equipment. It's great they have a women's only section that is well equipped.
However the way they get you to join is by pressuring you with deals. They advertise a '3 day free trial' but that's not really true, since you have to have a whole meeting about the gym and prices before you can try it, and then they'll hound you with deals you can only have if you join before working out. I wanted to actually try the gym before committing, but felt really pressured by this meeting (with Farah) and left with a bad taste in my mouth.
I signed up for 3 months to see if it was worth the price (around $72 per month). It's a good gym with lots of equipment and always pretty clean. It's never crazy busy either and other people here are friendly and just focused on their workout. The classes system is confusing as you have to pay extra for some of them and the booking on my app never worked, so I didn't try the classes.

They don't seem to pay much attention to the bathrooms as the women's was frequently out of toilet paper.

Their customer service is only contactable by email and they take over a week to reply, or just don't reply. This is really annoying when you want to freeze your membership or do other things that the front desk can't do.

Overall, I like this gym but they need to change the way they recruit new members. If it was a fixed price a month without all the fees and commitments I would probably stay. But the hassle and pressure isn't worth it for me, I'd rather go to a gym where it's the same price every month and they're not just trying to get your money.

featured_reviews.review_id:
This is a great gym.
The staff is very friendly and approachable if you have any questions and feedback on equipment etc.
I would give this gym 4.5 stars only because they are missing a few key pieces of equipment but that's only if your the body builder kinda guy.
But I did talk to them and they are planning on adding those pieces in the next couple years which is why I gave the 5 stars.
One is the pendulum squat machine which is one of the best machines to add on your leg day to really focus on the quads better than any workout you can think of for the quads.
The pendulum squat machine is very difficult to find in any gym so the fact that they're adding it is amazing.
Another is a standing lateral raise machine, Some call it a Watson machine.
Another is the standing T Bar Row, they do have the seated one, but it doesn't put you at the best angle but still workable.
All in all a great gym if you can avoid the busy hours.
Thank you Golds!!!

featured_reviews.review_id:
The quality of the gym is ok but the service needs tremendous work!

My wife and I tried cancelling our membership as we are moving to Europe. We gave the necessary proof of moving in regards to the cancellation policy but they charged an extra $300 to my credit card and stopped replying to my emails when I asked why I was charged this.

I guess since we're moving they think I wouldn't pursue this in the local court system. Very sketchy business practice! Be aware!

featured_reviews.review_id: For me to take time out of work and write a review is a lot, nor do I like to cause trouble. I just want to share my experience that can save others a hassle and potential harassment. Being a nurse and also a business owner, I didn't think I would go through a major downfall. Life happened where I lost my house and had to move in with relatives while I went through counselling and getting back on my feet now 2.5years later. These guys sent me to collections for over $600.00 not because of gym time I used but because OF A CONTRACT. Even knowing the circumstance I was in. With that being said, started then harassment phone calls, once again because of a CONTRACT. We are in an era where please try to refrain from any signage of contracts as possible. Then this year they sent another total to collections for an account that did not exist trying to collect extra money. Thank God I still kept the email of confirmation from 2.5 years ago. When I called, I knew I also needed email proof so they don't lie. Instead of an apology of trying to extort more money and sending it to collections, the women recanted and said she didn't have proof in writing but I sent the previous email for account closure and final receipt from the years prior. These idiots have caused so much time wastage and stress. To make time to even do this review, I'm at work on my break.  I could of course not afford a lawyer than whereas I can now and would of fought this just for the purpose of humanity. I have a membership with Club 16/She's Fit, Club Pilates and a personal trainer now. They are not like this. Transparency is key and this company really will Destry you when there is a bigger picture in life. DO NOT SIGN UP WITH THEM. THEY HAVE NOT CHANGED ANYTHING. Anyhow if you go through something in life, the customer service you will received from this company is beyond disgusting. There are many companies with policies in place like ones I work for and I own where we consider cancellation of services and deposit based on individual need. I will be posting more on my blogs in the upcoming months in regards to contracts. Also when approaching them, assure you have it in email - which is what I did to assure they didn't falsely take more money.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I had an incredibly disappointing experience at Gold's Gym in Port Coquitlam that has left me feeling both frustrated and disheartened. The management team there has consistently displayed a lack of customer service skills, bordering on rudeness. During all my workouts, I was abruptly told not to drop the weights, a message that could have been conveyed in a much more polite and professional manner.

But what truly pushed me over the edge was the handling of my membership cancellation. Amidst the COVID-19 pandemic, I called to cancel my membership and was under the impression that it had been taken care of. Imagine my surprise when I just recently found out my membership was still active, and I had been billed all this time. When I called to rectify the situation, I was met with vague responses and no straightforward answers.

I've since signed up with West Coast Iron, a nearby gym, and the difference in customer service and gym quality is night and day. Gold's Gym in Port Coquitlam has been by far the worst gym experience I've ever had, and I strongly urge anyone considering a membership to think twice.

featured_reviews.review_id: I was initially skeptical after hearing the negative feedback, but I decided to give it a shot and see what it was all about. I was greeted by friendly staff who were genuinely interested in helping me achieve my fitness goals. They took the time to understand my needs and provided valuable advice without pushing me into any unnecessary commitments. It was evident that they genuinely cared about creating a positive and inclusive environment for all members. The equipment at this gym is also really good, with a ton of options. The cleanliness of the gym was commendable too, and I appreciated the staff's efforts in maintaining a hygienic space. One incident that really stood out to me was when I encountered a small issue with one of the machines. I approached a staff member and they walked with me to the machine right away and then told the maintenance team. I think what sets this gym apart from other places I've been is really the positive and motivating atmosphere. The members here are friendly and supportive, creating a sense of community that is often lacking in other gyms. The trainers are approachable and always willing to offer guidance, making sure that you get the most out of your workout routine. To sum it up, despite the negative feedback, my personal experience has been nothing but positive. I encourage anyone who might have been skeptical like I was to give it a chance. You might just be pleasantly surprised, just like I was! Overall, I highly recommend Fitness World Kingsway to anyone looking for a gym that offers quality equipment, helpful staff, and a welcoming atmosphere.

featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Thanks for you comment, Kb!

Just to remind you (and anyone else that might be interested to know of our sign-up process) -- for every member that signs up, including yourself, we explain (both verbally along with presenting the written agreement in front of you to read as well) the full details of your membership agreement. Only after you've read/listened to/understood your agreement do we collect your signature. If you would like a copy of the contract you signed and agreed to, we either print or provide a PDF version of the agreement. You would then have 10 days to review that contract, and if for any reason, you're not happy with it, you're welcome to cancel with a 100% return of your sign-up fees. 


If you'd like a copy of that contract KB, please just give us a call and we can email it to you along with the signature on file :)

Regardless, we're sad to hear that you had a poor experience, and we'll continue to do our best to let everyone of our members know the details of their agreement that they've chosen as best suitable for them.

Take care, and wishing you the best of luck along your fitness journey!

featured_reviews.review_id:
The equipment is always needs repairs, and if you let the gym employees about the issues they brush you off as if you're being an annoyance. The female gym employees frequently walk through the men's change rooms, hopefully the same isn't true for the female change rooms. They openly let people take photos and videos in the change rooms, employees don't stop the behavior despite the signage saying it's not allowed.

If you want poor quality equipment needing repair and change rooms that do not feel secure, this is your gym.

Got a response from management who told me to do what I have already done on multiple occasions without change. Every time I bring up comments I ask that they write it down and I look for corrections but it has been months with no change.

Nov. 11 *Update* - Had another bad experience with an attendant calling me an idiot tonight as I finished my workout just as they were closing. I wasn't even the last person in the gym. Luckily his colleague walked over and said my workout was pretty cool but they'd like me to finish up and I did within 1 minute. Before the second person walked over the first guy was getting irate and I was worried he was going to hit me, he got in my personal space and threatened to drag me out like security. I was glad when the second person walked over and his presence calmed the first attendant. I finished my workout and quickly left the gym before closing time and ahead of a few other people.

We would encourage you to connect with the club manager to discuss your concerns at further length, so that they can be looked into accordingly. You can reach the manager by emailing burnabysovereign@goodlifefitness.com

featured_reviews.review_id:
My husband and I used to go to Goodlife Metrotown for more than a year. We had such a negative and stressful experience when we requested to freeze the membership:

1. I was pregnant, and as it was a risky pregnancy, I asked to freeze my membership. The staff member on the phone was very helpful and informed me that THEY WOULD CALL ME BEFORE I would be charged, close to the end of the period of freeze. I thought that it would be nice. They didn't call me and I WAS CHARGED even though I was unable to practice any physical activity. I called them to inform about what was agreed (what the employee had told me), they said that no one would call me. It is not the client's fault the training structure they offer to their employees.I didn't receive any refund, even I saying that I could send them the doctor's note.

2. Then, with a newborn at home, I requested the freeze again in a different period, and 2 days later, I WAS CHARGED. This is unacceptable. It is no the customer problem how is the financial dynamic of the company. We didn't receive the refund!

Finally, we requested to cancel the membership and also because we moved to Calgary. The staff member said that they need 30 days notice - what wasn't informed to us when we signed up. We said that we wanted to cancel right away and we also requested our refund for what we were charged on the 2nd time. The lady said that she would cancel it but the refund could not be made.

At the end of the day, we basically paid the 30 days notice with the money that we should receive as a refund (for the 2nd inappropriate charge).

We feel extremely harmed by this company, we feel that we were charged inappropriately. This is a company that cannot be trusted and that does not treat its customers honestly.

If you want to avoid headaches, avoid GoodLife Fitness.

featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Hi Marina, we are sorry to hear about your experience. We will confirm that GoodLife does not call members prior to the end of their membership freeze. Courtesy emails to remind are sent two weeks prior (if an email is provided). When it comes to freezing or making changes to the account, notice is required. We appreciate the feedback and wish you all the best.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I've been a member since this gym opened in 2015 or 2016. It's not what is used to be. Staff is rude and incompetent. Random issues happen with my membership through no fault of my own, and staff will spin up a random reason as to why you got charged and give wrong information. As of late there have been many new members joining and it's always overcrowded. People are not considerate at all, they'll leave their bag on a machine and walk away for 15 mins nowhere to be found. If you complain to management about others, they will instead put your account on a hold for a week. Seen it twice now. Place used to be the top gym around but sadly it's not the same. They'll keep jacking up prices and change nothing though.

Hopefully, you will not encounter any billing issues because 9 times out of 10 you will not be refunded or helped.

EDIT: Ironically, the only reason why I've left a review is because my emails haven't been responded to. I've sent multiple already.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I started with GoodLife in Calgary, AB not long ago.
And I was sent by my company to work in Vancouver for this Oct month.
So I started to google where is the nearest Goodlife in town.
After some research I picked this one(called Metrotown)but the location is actually right across Crystal Shopping Mall
I spent the last 7 days at this gym (at least 2 hours a day).
Here to share some of my own experience for the people who is planning to join.
-Parking. It is FREE(undergroud) they share the same parking space with the Element Hotel on P2 level
(Don't pay for the parking until you entering the gym in 2nd floor)
You will see a machine which offers you 2 hrs FREE parking
-Cleaness. I've been tryung out 3 different locations in Calgary Goodlife
None of those is satisfy until the first time I visited this one in Burnaby.
Both the gym & mens changing room are very tidy and clean.(sorry no chance visiting the women changing room)
And this is the only location I did my showers in 7 continue days.
The staff entering opposition gender changing room
I read complaints about this issue which is a male staff entering the women changing room to help a member w/o any notice
The same thing happen yesterday
A male member lost his key for his locker so a female staff entered tge mem's room to help him to cut his lock.
Also the female staff did not get anyone's attention before go in.
*(This is for sure an issue & hope the mangement can look into it ASAP)
-Shortage of towel
Everytime I obtain a clean &fresh towel when entering the gym. They may had that probelm years ago, but nit any more
-service of the staff
They are very friendly & helpful. The 1st time I couldn't find the entrance of the parking lot, so I called and the staff explained very clearly and be very patient to my questions.
And everyday when I left the gym
They say goodbye with a smiling face
-Equipment. this is the location with all the equipments I need.
-Other member attitude
Other member are also friendly, even sometime some people spend very long time on 1 machine(20mins). However, if you ask them and they are willing to share the machine in bewteen time.

Conclusion: there maybe some other location has a even better standard comapring to this Metrotown location
However, I have no complaint and also no bad feeling about this location in my last 7 days trial. Thank you and hope these infomation helps for your decision.

featured_reviews.review_id: It was really hard to figure out how to rate this place.. It's the only GoodLife near me and after reading all the reviews saying not to come between 5-10, I decided to try it out at 10:15pm on a Monday night. It. Was. Packed. The equipment is fine and exactly the same as any other GoodLife, but you won't get to use it. The space is waaay too small for the population it's trying to serve. I also didn't like how the whole place shakes whenever someone drops their weights (due to being on the second floor), which is constantly. I can't see how working out here after work is even possible and I have cancelled my GoodLife membership as a result. The space is clean, the staff are friendly enough, but I come to work out, not stand around.

featured_reviews.review_id: On paper this should be a very good gym. Good location, large space, and nice staff. But it's the placement of equipment paired with the shortage of equipment to match the volume of customers. This is a busy gym, and they waste so much space. 1/3 of the gym is filled with cardio equipment which is barely used. A very small free weight section. A large personal trainer section which is barely utilized, with a lot of that equipment being desperately needed by all the people going. The personal training area has too many squat racks, with not enough for everyone else. There is a large transition area towards a female only area. The transition has a few pieces of equipment for stretching and that's about it. It could have been used for more free weight area, which again is very needed. Would not recommend this gym in its current state. There are better GoodLife's.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Been a member for over 4 years. I pay almost $30 bi weekly. The hot yoga classes are always full, the gym equipment in the women's area has been broken for a long time. Specifically the cardio machines. They either don't adjust with the buttons, are in very poor shape, or they simply just shut off randomly. I've worked out in the co-ed side at night and have been harassed by other men who exercise there. Now the women's area is the only place I feel comfortable exercising in and even that area is below expectations. The steam room is always off. Towels everywhere, just overall unkept.

They also just got rid of the tanning beds completely. Prior to this their tanning was limited to every 24hours, in which they changed it to 48hrs, then just completely removed the service as a whole. I'm not sure what my membership even entitles anymore. It's not worth the price to exercise here unless the 24hour option is convenient for you. I was quoted less of a biweekly rate at Club Fitness right next door at Lougheed Mall which has way better equipment AND 24hr/tanning + classes with no contract commitments. Please do better as a gym to serve your existing clients as the condition of this gym is extremely dissatisfactory for the rates you are making members pay.

Highly recommend people in Burnaby to go there once while exploring gym options.

It's sad how other locations in Canada have more to offer such as pools, newer equipment and recovery rooms with meditation chairs/massage chairs that are private. But the Goodlife close to my house can't keep the mens change room clean or repair broken amenities.

I've been a member for sometime now so I'm holding on a bit longer to see if you guys can redeem yourself. Otherwise I'm switching gyms very soon.

Parking's always full, staff is either rude or too busy to even bother you're there. They'll promise you that the gym is due for an equipment upgrade but nothing changes. Treadmills come to a dead stop while running and the management couldn't be bothered less. Half of them don't even work.
Gym equipment is thrown about by other members but they will only enforce re-racking rules when it suits them. Staff is not trained in customer service at all. They only service you when they need to lock you into a contract. Forget even getting so much as a greeting while entering the premises after that.

Would give it a half star rating if I could.

Nothing premium about this gym. Definitely not worth $60 a month. Save your $ and look elsewhere.

featured_reviews.review_text:
- Please fix the machines that are broken why pay maintenance fees when there is no maintenance. There is quite a lot of machines broken. Or just replace them and get new ones.

- Renovate your showers, lockers, change rooms, washroom stalls. They are old enough to be due for reno.

- Steam room needs to be bigger. Saunas are old and broken need to be replaced.

- Drinking water is always cold. There should be option for room temperature water as well during winter months.

- Upstairs washroom door locks/door closers need replacement. These are heavily used doors so maintenance should be up to date.

I don't see any improvement since I have joined.

featured_reviews.review_id:
Moved and was looking for a gym closer . Very glad I kept my other gym memberships. We got Sucked into a contract-  the best way to get a decent monthly fee but now I'm committed to full fill my 2 years. Other than location, the reason we joined was because of the hot tub and pool. Hot tub has been out of order 35% of times I have been here to work out.  Back hall to pool is cold and showers are awful. No hooks or benches to keep your towel or clothing off the floor and dry and it's too wet, dirty and cold to want to use them without having your change of clothing with you  During busy times no staff putting away weights, can't find anything. We work out in the evenings and often there are 3+ staff behind the counter, they say hi- but seem more interested in talking about their dates and looking at a hotel others phones.

I asked for a discount. I'm stuck in a contract and hoped it was the least they could do for me. It took 3 months and at least 6 calls and requests to have the mama heft contact me and was told no. I'm going to ask a lawyer to go over my contact and see if I can just end it

I still have my member ship with Anytime Fitness and am glad. I won't be renewing my membership when this one's done.

featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text:
Hello Lacey,

Thanks for writing a detailed review for us as it helps us do better !

Firstly, we understand the importance of the amenities, such as the hot tub and pool, that we offer at our gym. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused by the intermittent closures earlier this year. We acknowledge that there were maintenance challenges that affected the availability of the hot tub during the months you mentioned.

Firstly, one of the pipes that was essential for the functioning of the hot tub broke down unexpectedly. We ordered the new parts right away but because of the supply chain issues it took longer than expected. Further, there were chemical imbalances and a sudden visit by Fraser health led us to closing it. We have taken measures to rectify the situation and are pleased to inform you that the hot tub has been fully operational for a considerable period now, without any reported issues. Also, we drain the water every Thursday to fill it back in and that has helped us a whole lot in preventing these unforeseen occurrences.

As for the club runs, we value your feedback and will definitely be talking to the staff to better utilize their time and are more attentive to the member needs. 

While we are unable to offer a discount on your membership, as our membership agreements and pricing structure are standardized for all members, we are committed to providing you with an improved experience moving forward. We value your loyalty and feedback, and we are dedicated to making the necessary improvements to ensure you have a positive and enjoyable time at our gym.


We are truly sorry to hear that you won't be renewing your membership with us, but we respect your decision and hope you continue to enjoy your membership with Anytime Fitness. If there's anything else we can do to improve your experience, please don't hesitate to let us know.

featured_reviews.review_id:
TOTAL SCAM. I would have given 0 star if possible.
They pushed me into buying a membership and personal training packages, signing their awful contract ,and of course, they charged me a fortune. I specifically inquired about cancellation policies because I expected to move and wouldn't be able to commute to any Gold's Gym locations. They assured me I could cancel without fees if I moved, but I don't even want to remember how much they charged me before finally canceling my membership. It was a terrible experience dealing with the gym manager of that time,Jean, and I'm traumatized from ever considering any gym contract/packages again!

I still regret not disputing all the money they charged me for both the gym membership and PT sessions, even though I couldn't use any of the sessions for months after expressing my desire to cancel my membership.
The only positive aspect was my personal trainer, Michelle, who I learned a lot from, and she had nothing to do with the management's actions.
Overall, the worst gym facility experience.

I'm truly sorry to learn about the negative experience you had with our gym. Your feedback is  important, and I want to express my sincerest apologies for the frustration and inconvenience you've endured as a result of your interactions with our team.

I completely understand your concern about the membership and personal training packages you were pushed into purchasing, especially considering the subsequent challenges with cancellation and associated charges. It's disheartening to know that our handling of your situation fell short of your expectations, causing you distress and a reluctance to consider gym contracts in the future.

Normally, if you are moving 30km away from the gym and provide a copy of one of the acceptable proof of move, it should have been a seamless process. Regardless, I apologize for any confusion or lack of clarity in our cancellation policies at that time. We are committed to improving our policies to ensure they're transparent and member-friendly to prevent such instances in the future.

I deeply regret any negative experiences you had with our previous gym manager, Jean. Rest assured, we take your concerns seriously and will look into this matter further to enhance our management interactions and overall customer service.

On a positive note, I'm glad to hear that your personal trainer, Michelle, made a positive impact during your time at our gym. Our trainers are dedicated to helping members like you achieve their fitness goals, and it's heartening to know that Michelle played a valuable role in your fitness journey.

If there's anything more you'd like to share or if you have specific suggestions on how we can improve our services, I'm here to listen. Your feedback is invaluable to us, and we're committed to using it to make meaningful changes to provide a better experience for all our members.
